page.title: 01General Introduction
page.content: Chilcompton and Stratton-on-the -Fosse, are mainly rural areas. The villages are situated about 12 miles from Bath and 2 miles from Midsomer Norton. The population of each village is around 1,600. There are a number of farms, mostly dairy, and a little light industry. Downside Abbey and School dominate the area with many of the staff who work there, living in the villages. Much of the land is owned by either the Abbey or the Duchy of Cornwall. Because of this there is no major development. Prince Charles, the Prince of Wales, occasionally visits the villages to meet people who work on his farms.
